keyword: how many calories in a biscuit
title: How Many Calories Are in a Biscuit?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a biscuit, including carbs, fat, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Biscuit?
assumptions: Standard American-style buttermilk biscuit, homemade or bakery-fresh, plain (no added toppings), about 60 g each.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, and preparation method (e.g., butter vs. shortening). Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One plain biscuit has about 200 kcal, with 25 g carbs and 10 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a plain biscuit?
faqs.a: Approximately 200 kcal for one standard 60 g buttermilk biscuit.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a biscuit?
faqs.a: About 25 g carbs, 10 g fat, 4 g protein, and 1 g fiber per biscuit.
Yes, around 400 mg sodium per biscuit due to baking powder and salt.

faqs.q: How do calories change with toppings?
faqs.a: Adding butter or jam can increase calories by 30â€“50 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: What's the difference between American and British biscuits?
faqs.a: American biscuits are savory scones (~200 kcal); British are sweet cookies (~50 kcal each).
